content:
After speaking about peace and safety, Yahweh adds a surprising promise: “You will pursue your enemies and kill them with your swords… Five of you will chase a hundred, and a hundred of you will chase ten thousand.”
This is not normal human math. Yahweh is teaching something clear: when He is with His people, weakness overcomes strength. Victory is not based on numbers. It is based on Yahweh’s presence.

In the prophets and the stories of Israel, we see this pattern often.
God causes fear to fall on the enemy. God throws armies into confusion.
God makes the mighty fall before the weak. This is why Scripture says the battle belongs to God. It is not “human power plus God.” It is God Himself defending His purpose.

In the Kingdom application, this becomes spiritual and worldwide.
The real enemies of resurrected mankind are internal. The deepest enemies are inside: sin, wrong desire, pride, selfishness, and every “old character” that came from Adam’s fall. During the Kingdom, people will be taught by his Word. And just as God promised victory to Israel when they walked in His ways, the King will give victory to mankind as they learn obedience.

This is where the “sword” becomes very meaningful. In our spiritual understanding, the sword points to the Word of God; His truth that cuts through lies, exposes sin, and defeats the enemy within. People will not be left without help. They will hear, read, and learn. And Yahweh’s Word will become their weapon against the old self. When the truth enters the mind, it begins to chase out darkness.

The blessings also Five of you will chase a hundred, and a hundred of you will chase ten thousand!

There is a tender picture here: “five” can remind us of the five books of the Torah. Even in Jesus’ own victory over the Adversary, He answered with written truth from the Torah. So we can see the thought like this: when the Word of Yahweh becomes alive in the heart, even a few truths can chase many evil thoughts. Even a small beginning of obedience can overcome a large weight of old habits. In the Kingdom, the Word will be everywhere, and the victory over sin will spread wider and wider through the whole earth.

Then Yahweh says, “I will bless you and cause you to have many children.”
In our study, we do not have to reduce this only to physical increase. Yes, Israel understood it as family growth. But spiritually, in the New Creation picture, “children” also speaks of those who become obedient, shaped, and born of God’s work. John speaks of people becoming “children of God,” born not by human power, but by God (John 1:12-13). Paul even uses childbirth language to describe Christ being formed in believers (Galatians 4:19). So in the Kingdom, as resurrected mankind receives Yahweh’s Word and obeys it, righteousness will multiply like children. Those who learn will help others learn. Those who are healed will help others be healed. Light will produce more light.

And there is another picture: the Bride class, faithful now, will have the world as her “children” in the sense of nurturing, teaching, and helping them toward full restoration under Christ. In that age, humanity will not be left to wander blindly. The King and His priestly arrangement will guide the earth into righteousness.

Now we come to the highest blessing in Leviticus 26. Yahweh says, “I will live among you in my Sacred Tent, and I will never reject you. I will walk among you and continue to be your God, and you will continue to be my people.” This is the heart of everything. Land and food and victory are wonderful, but the greatest blessing is Yahweh Himself being near.

The prophets repeat this promise in a stronger voice. Ezekiel says,
“My dwelling place will be with them; I will be their God, and they will be My people” (Ezekiel 37:26-28). Isaiah calls the people to shout for joy because “great is the Holy One… among you” (Isaiah 12:6). Zechariah says, “I am coming, and I will live among you… Many nations will be joined to Yahweh in that day” (Zechariah 2:10-11). Notice that last line: not only Israel, but many nations. This shows the Kingdom reach. It is global. It is an earth filled with worship, learning, and Yahweh’s presence.

And then, this blessing stretches beyond the Millennium into the “eighth day” glory. Leviticus 26 says Yahweh will walk among His people. Revelation shows the final, complete form of that promise: “Now the dwelling of God is with mankind, and He will live with them. They will be His people” (Revelation 21:3). And again, “The throne of God and of the Lamb will be… and they will see His face” (Revelation 22:3-4). This is the destination of the whole plan: not only peace around us, but Yahweh with us; not only safety from enemies, but closeness to our Father; not only life restored, but relationship restored.

So Leviticus 26 is like a map drawn in simple words. It begins with obedience and ends with presence. It begins with fields and ends with Yahweh’s dwelling. It shows that the Kingdom blessings are not random gifts; they are the fruit of righteous rule. When Messiah reigns, abundance becomes normal, fear is removed, enemies are defeated, mankind becomes fruitful in righteousness, and Yahweh’s presence becomes the greatest joy.

This should help us today as New Creation people. Even now, we taste small samples. Yahweh gives peace to the heart. He feeds us with His Word.
He teaches us to fight inner enemies with truth. He trains us to desire the coming world. And as we wait, Leviticus 26 reminds us: God’s covenant heart has not changed. What He promised, He will fulfill; first in the Peaceable Kingdom under Christ, and then in the final glory where Yahweh’s dwelling is fully with mankind.

title: Prayer
text:
Father, we thank You that You will dwell with Your people and never reject those who belong to You.
We praise You for the promise that Your presence will walk among mankind, and Your peace will cover the earth.

Please form in us the obedience and love that fits Your Kingdom, and make us a clean home for Your Spirit.

Help us to bear fruits; and godly character - so others may be blessed through your light.
All glory to You for completing Your plan through our Lord Jesus Christ, amen.
